The claim was initially made by News Nat: who provided a description of the painting and its exhibition in a Guwahati art gallery.
The painting was shared by other individ: including NewsX anchor Shehzad Poonawallah, ISKCON Long Island, and Madhu Kishwar, who expressed their outrage and called for action against the painter.
The incident dates back to April 2015: when the Guwahati police registered an FIR against the painter based on a complaint filed by the Hindu Jagran Manch. The police confirmed that the painting had been removed and the artist had apologized.
The Guwahati police also confirmed that: Akram Hussain, was arrested on May 30, 2015, in response to the viral claims.
